Greek.cooking_instructions: Salt eggplant slices and let sit for 30 minutes. Rinse and pat dry. Brown ground lamb with onion and garlic. Add tomatoes, paste, and seasonings. Simmer for 20 minutes. Make béchamel sauce with butter, flour, milk, eggs, cheese, and nutmeg. Layer eggplant, meat sauce, and béchamel in baking dish. Bake at 375°F for 45 minutes until golden.

Mix nuts with sugar and spices. Layer phyllo sheets with melted butter and nut mixture. Cut into diamonds. Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes. Make syrup with sugar, water, honey, cinnamon, and lemon juice. Pour hot syrup over cooled baklava. Let sit for 4 hours before serving.

Sauté onion and green onions until soft. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Cool and squeeze out excess water. Mix with herbs, feta, eggs, and seasonings. Layer phyllo sheets with olive oil and spinach mixture. Bake at 375°F for 45 minutes until golden.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Brown ground beef with onion and garlic. Add tomatoes, paste, and seasonings. Simmer for 20 minutes. Make béchamel sauce. Layer pasta, meat sauce, and béchamel in baking dish. Bake at 375°F for 45 minutes until golden.
Combine all vegetables in a large bowl. Add olives and feta cheese. Whisk together olive oil, vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over salad and toss gently. Serve immediately.

Italian.cooking_instructions: Season veal shanks with salt and pepper. Brown in oil and butter. Add vegetables and cook until soft. Add wine, stock, tomatoes, and seasonings. Simmer for 2 hours until tender. Serve with risotto and gremolata.

Soak mushrooms in hot water. Sauté onion and garlic in oil. Add rice and cook for 2 minutes. Add wine and cook until absorbed. Add stock gradually, stirring constantly. Add mushrooms and cook until rice is creamy. Stir in cheese and butter. Garnish with parsley.

Pound veal cutlets thin. Top each with prosciutto and sage leaf. Secure with toothpicks. Dredge in flour. Cook in oil for 2 minutes per side. Add wine and stock. Simmer for 5 minutes. Remove toothpicks and serve hot.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Heat oil and cook garlic and chilies. Add wine and cook until reduced. Add tomatoes and simmer for 15 minutes. Toss with pasta. Garnish with parsley and serve with Parmesan.

Beat egg yolks with sugar until thick. Add mascarpone and mix well. Whip cream and fold into mixture. Mix coffee with liqueur. Dip ladyfingers in coffee mixture. Layer in dish with cream mixture. Chill for 4 hours. Dust with cocoa powder before serving.

ingredients: 1 lb chicken thighs, cut into pieces
Spanish.cooking_instructions: Heat oil in large paella pan. Brown chicken and rabbit. Add vegetables and cook until soft. Add rice and cook for 2 minutes. Add stock, saffron, and seasonings. Simmer for 20 minutes without stirring. Let rest for 5 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.
Chop all vegetables. Blend with oil, vinegar, and seasonings. Add water gradually until smooth. Chill for 2 hours. Serve cold with basil garnish.
Cook potatoes and onion in oil until tender. Beat eggs with salt. Add potato mixture to eggs. Cook in large skillet until set. Flip and cook other side. Serve warm or cold.
Boil octopus for 45 minutes until tender. Boil potatoes until done. Slice octopus and potatoes. Drizzle with oil and sprinkle with paprika and salt. Garnish with parsley and serve.

Boil water, butter, and salt. Add flour and stir until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time. Pipe into hot oil and fry until golden. Roll in cinnamon sugar. For chocolate, heat cream and add chocolate and sugar. Stir until smooth. Serve churros with chocolate sauce.
Combine tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and olives in bowl. Top with feta cheese. Whisk olive oil, vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper. Drizzle over salad. Toss gently and serve immediately.
Blend chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, olive oil, cumin, and salt until smooth. Add water if needed for consistency. Serve with pita bread and vegetables.
Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on plate. Tuck basil leaves between slices. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Heat olive oil and cook garlic until golden. Add red pepper flakes. Toss pasta with oil mixture. Add parsley and Parmesan. Season with salt. Serve immediately.
Toast bread slices. Mix tomatoes, garlic, basil, olive oil, and balsamic vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Top bread with tomato mixture. Serve immediately.
Blend all vegetables until smooth. Add olive oil and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Chill for 10 minutes. Serve cold with fresh herbs.
Spread hummus on tortillas. Layer with greens, cucumber, tomatoes, feta, and olives. Drizzle with olive oil. Roll tightly and slice in half. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil and cook onion until soft. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add eggplant, zucchini, and bell pepper. Cook for 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and herbs. Simmer for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

Soak bulgur in boiling water for 10 minutes. Drain and cool. Mix with tomatoes, cucumber, parsley, and mint. Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, and salt. Toss with salad. Chill for 10 minutes before serving.
Squeeze spinach dry. Mix with feta, eggs, herbs, salt, and pepper. Brush phyllo with olive oil. Layer 4 sheets, add filling, top with 4 more sheets. Bake at 375°F for 20 minutes until golden.
Season lamb with oregano, salt, and pepper. Heat oil and cook lamb for 8 minutes. Warm pita breads. Fill with lamb, onion, tomatoes, cucumber, and tzatziki. Roll and serve hot.
Cook pasta according to package. Heat oil and cook garlic for 1 minute. Add vegetables and cook for 5 minutes. Toss with pasta, Parmesan, and basil. Season with salt and pepper.
Cook potatoes and onion in oil until tender. Beat eggs with salt and pepper. Add potato mixture to eggs. Cook in pan until set. Flip and cook other side. Serve warm.
Cook quinoa in water for 15 minutes. Mix with cucumber, tomato, olives, and feta. Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Toss with quinoa mixture. Serve at room temperature.
Season chicken with oregano, salt, and pepper. Heat oil and cook chicken for 6 minutes per side. Add garlic and lemon juice. Cook for 2 more minutes. Serve hot.
Toast bread slices. Mix tomatoes, garlic, basil, olive oil, and balsamic vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Top bread with tomato mixture. Serve immediately.
Heat oil in pan. Add potatoes and cook for 12 minutes until golden and crispy. Season with paprika, cayenne, and salt. Serve with aioli sauce.
Season fish with oregano, salt, and pepper. Heat oil and cook fish for 4 minutes per side. Add garlic, lemon juice, and olives. Cook for 2 more minutes. Serve hot.
Squeeze cucumber dry. Mix with yogurt, garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, and dill. Season with salt. Chill for 10 minutes. Serve with pita bread.

Sauté onion and garlic until soft. Add rice and cook for 2 minutes. Add broth gradually, stirring constantly. Cook for 18 minutes until creamy. Stir in Parmesan and butter. Season with salt and pepper.
Blend all vegetables until smooth. Add olive oil and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Chill for 10 minutes. Serve cold with croutons.
Cook pasta according to package. Heat oil and cook garlic for 1 minute. Add olives and sun-dried tomatoes. Toss with pasta, feta, and basil. Season with salt and pepper.

Cook eggplant slices for 5 minutes. Brown lamb with onion and garlic. Add tomatoes and cinnamon. Simmer for 10 minutes. Layer eggplant and lamb mixture. Top with Parmesan. Bake at 375°F for 20 minutes.

Cook pasta according to package. Cook bacon until crispy. Beat eggs with Parmesan and black pepper. Toss hot pasta with bacon and garlic. Remove from heat and add egg mixture. Toss quickly until creamy.

Brown chicken in pan for 5 minutes. Add onion and garlic. Cook for 2 minutes. Add rice and cook for 2 minutes. Add broth, peas, bell peppers, and saffron. Simmer for 18 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

Spanish.title: Mediterranean Seafood Paella
ingredients: 1 lb chicken thighs, cut into pieces (450g)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
utensils_required: Large paella pan or wide shallow pan
instructions: Heat olive oil in paella pan over medium-high heat. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Brown chicken pieces for 5 minutes per side. Remove and set aside.
Add chorizo and cook for 3 minutes until browned. Add onion and garlic, cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Add tomatoes, bell pepper, and rice. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add wine and cook until absorbed.
Add stock, saffron, and paprika. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to medium. Add chicken back to pan.
Simmer for 15 minutes without stirring. Add seafood and peas. Cook for 5 more minutes until rice is tender and seafood is cooked. Garnish with parsley and serve with lemon wedges.
Spanish.chef_tips: The key to perfect paella is not stirring after adding the stock. The socarrat (crispy bottom layer) is the prize. Use the widest pan possible for even cooking and authentic presentation.

Spanish.title: Mediterranean Stuffed Eggplant
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Cut eggplants in half lengthwise. Score flesh and brush with 1/4 cup olive oil. Bake for 30 minutes until tender.
Scoop out eggplant flesh, leaving shells intact. Chop flesh and set aside.
Heat remaining oil in large skillet. Add onion and garlic, cook for 5 minutes until softened. Add tomatoes and cook for 3 minutes.
Add eggplant flesh, pine nuts, raisins, herbs, and spices. Cook for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Fill eggplant shells with mixture. Top with feta and breadcrumbs. Bake for 20 minutes until golden. Serve warm.
Spanish.chef_tips: The eggplant should be tender but not mushy. The combination of sweet raisins, savory pine nuts, and aromatic spices creates the perfect Mediterranean flavor profile.

Spanish.title: Mediterranean Grilled Octopus
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Bring large pot of salted water to boil. Add bay leaves and onion. Add octopus and simmer for 45 minutes until tender.
Drain octopus and let cool. Cut into serving pieces.
Make marinade: whisk olive oil, vinegar, garlic, oregano, paprika, and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.
Marinate octopus for 30 minutes. Preheat grill to high heat.
Grill octopus for 3-4 minutes per side until charred and crispy. Serve with marinade and garnish with parsley and lemon wedges.
Spanish.chef_tips: The key is slow poaching followed by high-heat grilling. The octopus should be tender inside and crispy outside. Don't overcook during the poaching stage.

Spanish.title: Mediterranean Lamb Tagine
ingredients: 2 lbs lamb shoulder, cut into cubes (900g)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Season lamb with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in tagine over medium-high heat. Brown lamb in batches for 5 minutes per side. Remove and set aside.
Add onions and garlic to tagine. Cook for 8 minutes until softened. Add spices and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Return lamb to tagine. Add tomatoes, dried fruits, and stock. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to low.
Cover and simmer for 1.5 hours until lamb is tender. Add almonds and cook for 10 more minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with couscous.
Spanish.chef_tips: The slow, gentle cooking in a tagine creates incredibly tender meat. The combination of sweet dried fruits and savory lamb is quintessentially Mediterranean.

Spanish.title: Mediterranean Stuffed Grape Leaves (Dolmas)
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: If using fresh grape leaves, blanch in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Make filling: mix rice, onion, garlic, pine nuts, currants, herbs, olive oil, lemon juice, and spices. Season with salt and pepper.
Place grape leaves vein-side up. Add 1 tbsp filling to center of each leaf. Fold sides over filling and roll tightly.
Arrange dolmas in steamer insert. Add water to pot and steam for 45 minutes until rice is tender.
Let cool to room temperature. Serve with lemon wedges.
Spanish.chef_tips: The rolling technique takes practice - the dolmas should be tight but not overstuffed. The combination of herbs and spices creates the authentic Mediterranean flavor.

Spanish.title: Mediterranean Seafood Stew (Bouillabaisse)
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Fresh parsley and fennel fronds for garnish
instructions: Heat olive oil in large pot over medium heat. Add onions, garlic, and fennel. Cook for 8 minutes until softened.
Add tomatoes, orange peel, fennel seeds, bay leaves, and saffron. Cook for 5 minutes until tomatoes break down.
Add fish stock and wine. Bring to boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Add fish fillets and cook for 5 minutes. Add shellfish and cook for 3-4 minutes until shells open. Discard any unopened shells.
Ladle into bowls, garnish with parsley and fennel fronds. Serve with rouille sauce and crusty bread.
Spanish.chef_tips: The key is using the freshest seafood possible and building layers of flavor with the aromatic base. The saffron is essential for authentic bouillabaisse.

Spanish.title: Greek Spanakopita (Spinach Pie)
ingredients: 2 lbs fresh spinach, washed and chopped (900g)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Add spinach in batches, cooking until wilted and excess moisture evaporates, about 8 minutes. Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
Transfer spinach to large bowl. Let cool slightly, then add feta, ricotta, eggs, dill, and parsley. Mix well.
Brush baking dish with melted butter. Layer 8 phyllo sheets, brushing each with butter. Add spinach filling.
Top with remaining phyllo sheets, brushing each with butter. Score top into squares. Bake for 35-40 minutes until golden brown.
Spanish.chef_tips: Ensure spinach is completely dry before mixing with cheese to prevent soggy phyllo. The key is layering phyllo properly and brushing each sheet with butter for crispiness.

Spanish.title: Greek Souvlaki with Tzatziki
ingredients: 1.5 lbs pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes (680g)
Sliced tomatoes and red onions for serving
instructions: Combine pork with olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, thyme, salt, and pepper. Marinate for 30 minutes at room temperature.
For tzatziki: Grate cucumber, salt lightly, and let drain in towel for 10 minutes. Mix with yogurt, garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, and dill.
Thread pork onto skewers. Grill over medium-high heat for 12-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through.
Warm pita breads on grill for 1 minute per side. Serve souvlaki with tzatziki, tomatoes, and onions.
Spanish.chef_tips: Don't overcook the pork - it should be juicy and slightly pink inside. The tzatziki needs time for flavors to meld, so make it ahead if possible.

Spanish.title: Greek Avgolemono Soup
ingredients: 1 whole chicken, cut into pieces (3-4 lbs) (1.4-1.8kg)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Place chicken in large pot with stock. Bring to boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
Remove chicken and strain stock. Return stock to pot, add rice, and simmer for 15 minutes until rice is tender.
Whisk egg whites until frothy. Gradually whisk in egg yolks, then lemon juice. Temper with hot stock, whisking constantly.
Slowly whisk egg mixture into soup. Add dill, season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately with lemon wedges.
Spanish.chef_tips: The key is tempering the eggs slowly to prevent curdling. The soup should be silky smooth with a perfect balance of lemon and chicken flavors.

Spanish.title: Greek Pastitsio
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions until al dente. Drain and set aside. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Brown ground meats with onion and garlic in large skillet over medium heat for 8 minutes. Add tomatoes, paste, wine, and spices. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Make béchamel: Melt butter, whisk in flour, cook for 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in milk, cook until thickened. Remove from heat, whisk in eggs and half the cheese.
Layer half the pasta in baking dish. Top with meat sauce, then remaining pasta. Pour béchamel over top, sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake for 45-50 minutes until golden brown and bubbly. Let rest for 15 minutes before serving.
Spanish.chef_tips: This is Greece's answer to lasagna. The key is the perfect béchamel sauce and letting it rest before cutting to maintain layers.

Spanish.title: Greek Dolmades (Stuffed Grape Leaves)
instructions: Rinse grape leaves and blanch in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain and set aside. Rinse rice until water runs clear.
Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes until softened. Add rice, dill, mint, parsley, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Cook for 3 minutes.
Place grape leaf vein-side up. Add 1 tbsp rice mixture near stem end. Fold sides over, then roll tightly from stem to tip.
Arrange dolmades seam-side down in pot. Add stock and remaining olive oil. Cover with plate to weigh down. Simmer for 40 minutes until rice is tender.
Let cool in pot. Serve at room temperature with lemon wedges.
Spanish.chef_tips: The key is not overstuffing the leaves and rolling them tightly. The plate on top prevents them from unraveling during cooking.

Spanish.title: Greek Loukoumades (Honey Puffs)
instructions: Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. Let stand for 5 minutes until foamy. Mix flour and salt in large bowl.
Add yeast mixture to flour. Mix until smooth dough forms. Cover and let rise for 1 hour until doubled.
Heat oil to 375°F (190°C) in deep fryer. Drop small spoonfuls of dough into hot oil. Fry for 3-4 minutes until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels. Warm honey in small saucepan. Drizzle over puffs, sprinkle with walnuts and cinnamon, dust with powdered sugar.
Spanish.chef_tips: These are Greece's answer to donuts. The key is maintaining consistent oil temperature and not overcrowding the fryer.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil in large paella pan over medium-high heat. Season chicken with salt and pepper, cook until golden, about 5 minutes. Add onion, garlic, and bell pepper. Cook until softened, about 4 minutes. Add rice and stir to coat with oil. Add tomatoes, wine, saffron, paprika, and turmeric. Stir well and cook for 2 minutes until wine is absorbed. Add hot stock, bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, simmer uncovered for 15 minutes without stirring. Arrange seafood on top of rice. Cover and cook for 8-10 minutes until seafood is cooked and rice is tender. Serve with lemon wedges and parsley.

Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Cut eggplants in half lengthwise, score flesh in crosshatch pattern. Brush with 2 tbsp olive oil, season with salt. Bake eggplants for 25 minutes until tender. Let cool, scoop out flesh leaving shells intact. Chop flesh and set aside. Heat remaining oil in large skillet. Add onion and garlic, cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add chopped eggplant flesh, tomatoes, pine nuts, raisins, mint, parsley, cinnamon, and allspice. Cook for 8 minutes until flavors meld. Fill eggplant shells with mixture, top with feta. Bake for 15 minutes until heated through and feta is golden.

Bring large pot of salted water to boil. Add octopus, reduce heat to simmer. Cook for 45 minutes until tender when pierced with fork. Drain octopus, let cool. Cut into 2-inch pieces. Combine olive oil, garlic, oregano, lemon zest, paprika, salt, and pepper. Marinate octopus pieces in mixture for 30 minutes at room temperature. Heat grill to high. Grill octopus for 3-4 minutes per side until charred and heated through. Transfer to serving platter, drizzle with lemon juice, sprinkle with parsley. Serve with lemon wedges.

ingredients: 2 lbs lamb shoulder, cut into 2-inch pieces (900g)
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil in large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Season lamb with salt and pepper, brown on all sides, about 8 minutes. Add onions and garlic, cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add cumin, coriander, cinnamon, and ginger, cook for 1 minute until fragrant. Add tomatoes, apricots, olives, and honey. Bring to boil, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 1.5 hours until lamb is tender. Uncover and simmer for 15 minutes to reduce sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with cilantro and serve over couscous.

Rinse grape leaves, blanch in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain and set aside. Rinse rice until water runs clear. Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in large pot. Add onion and garlic, cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add rice, pine nuts, currants, herbs, allspice, salt, and pepper. Cook for 3 minutes until rice is lightly toasted. Place grape leaf vein-side up, add 1 tbsp filling near stem end. Fold sides over filling, roll tightly from stem to tip. Arrange dolmas seam-side down in pot, add stock and remaining olive oil. Cover with plate, simmer for 45 minutes until rice is tender.

Heat olive oil in large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and fennel, cook until softened, about 8 minutes. Add tomatoes, wine, saffron, fennel seeds, and bay leaf. Cook for 5 minutes until wine is reduced by half. Add fish stock, bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes to develop flavors. Add fish fillets, cook for 5 minutes. Add mussels and shrimp, cook for 3-4 minutes until mussels open and shrimp are pink. Discard any unopened mussels. Season with salt and pepper, garnish with parsley. Serve with rouille.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil in large pot over medium heat. Add onions, carrots, and celery. Cook for 10 minutes until softened. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add tomatoes, tomato paste, bay leaves, and thyme. Cook for 5 minutes. Add half the beans and mash with wooden spoon. Add stock, bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Add cavolo nero and remaining beans. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add bread cubes and cook for 10 minutes until bread breaks down. Season with salt and pepper. Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The bread should be very stale - this is key to authentic ribollita. Let it rest after cooking to allow flavors to meld. Serve with a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil and grated Parmesan.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Make risotto: Heat butter in saucepan, add onion and garlic. Cook until soft. Add rice and stir for 2 minutes. Add wine and cook until absorbed. Add hot stock gradually, stirring constantly for 18-20 minutes until creamy. Add Parmesan and season. Cool completely. Mix in peas. Form into balls with mozzarella in center. Coat in flour, egg, then breadcrumbs. Heat oil to 180°C (356°F). Fry arancini for 3-4 minutes until golden. Drain on paper towels.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The risotto must be completely cool before shaping. Wet your hands when forming balls to prevent sticking. Fry in small batches to maintain oil temperature. Serve immediately while hot and crispy.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Cut cuttlefish into rings. Heat olive oil in sauté pan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, cook until soft. Add cuttlefish and cook for 5 minutes. Add wine and cook until reduced by half. Add tomato paste and bay leaf. Cook for 2 minutes. Add fish stock and simmer for 15 minutes. Add ink sacs and stir well. Season with salt and pepper. Meanwhile, cook polenta in remaining stock for 20 minutes, stirring constantly. Serve cuttlefish over polenta, garnished with parsley.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Handle ink sacs carefully - they can stain. The ink adds a unique briny flavor. Don't overcook the cuttlefish or it becomes rubbery. Serve with crusty bread to mop up the sauce.

ingredients: 100ml San Marzano tomato sauce (3.4 fl oz)
utensils_required: Wood-fired oven or very hot oven (500°C/932°F)
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Preheat oven to maximum temperature with pizza stone. Stretch dough by hand to 30cm circle. Dust peel with semolina. Place dough on peel. Spread tomato sauce thinly, leaving border. Tear mozzarella into pieces and distribute. Drizzle with olive oil. Slide onto hot stone. Bake for 60-90 seconds until crust is charred and cheese is bubbly. Remove and immediately add fresh basil. Drizzle with more olive oil and sea salt.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The key is extreme heat - 500°C minimum. Stretch dough by hand, never roll. Less is more with toppings. The pizza should cook in under 90 seconds. Fresh basil goes on after baking to prevent wilting.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente. Reserve 60ml cooking water. Heat olive oil in large sauté pan over medium heat. Add black pepper and toast for 1 minute until fragrant. Add drained pasta and half the cooking water. Toss vigorously. Remove from heat. Add grated cheese gradually while tossing continuously. Add more cooking water if needed to create creamy sauce. Serve immediately.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The key is the starchy pasta water and constant tossing. Remove from heat before adding cheese to prevent clumping. Use freshly cracked pepper for best flavor. The sauce should be creamy, not watery.

ingredients: 200ml extra virgin olive oil (6.8 fl oz)
utensils_required: Mortar and pestle (traditional) or food processor
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Wash and dry basil leaves completely. In mortar, crush garlic with pinch of salt. Add pine nuts and crush to paste. Add basil leaves gradually, crushing to paste. Add cheeses and mix well. Slowly drizzle in olive oil while stirring. Season with salt. Cook pasta in salted water until al dente. Reserve 60ml cooking water. Toss pasta with pesto and cooking water. Serve immediately.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Use a mortar and pestle for authentic texture. Never heat pesto - it turns black. Dry basil completely to prevent oxidation. Add pasta water to help the sauce cling to pasta. Serve immediately after mixing.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil in large pot over medium heat. Add pancetta and cook until crispy. Add onion, carrot, and celery. Cook for 10 minutes until soft. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add ground meats and cook until browned. Add wine and cook until reduced by half. Add tomatoes, stock, and bay leaves. Simmer for 2 hours, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper. Cook pasta until al dente. Toss with ragù and serve with grated cheese.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The soffritto (onion, carrot, celery) is crucial - cook until very soft. Long, slow cooking develops deep flavors. Don't rush the process. The ragù should be thick and rich, not watery.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Make pasta dough and roll into thin sheets. Mix meat, spinach, cheese, egg yolk, nutmeg, salt, and pepper for filling. Place small mounds of filling on pasta sheet. Fold over and seal edges. Cut into small rectangles. Pinch edges to seal. Cook in salted boiling water for 3-4 minutes. Heat butter in sauté pan until foaming. Add sage leaves. Toss cooked agnolotti in butter. Serve with grated cheese.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The 'plin' refers to the pinch that seals the pasta. Don't overfill - the pasta should be delicate. Cook sage in butter until crispy for best flavor. The pasta should be al dente when served.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil in sauté pan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, cook until soft. Add lamb and cook until browned. Add fennel seeds and cook for 1 minute. Add wine and cook until reduced by half. Add tomatoes and saffron. Simmer for 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Cook pasta until al dente. Toss with sauce and serve with grated Pecorino Sardo.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Malloreddus are traditional Sardinian gnocchi-shaped pasta. The saffron gives the sauce its characteristic golden color. Don't skip the fennel seeds - they're essential for authentic flavor.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Cook spaghetti in salted water until al dente. Reserve 60ml cooking water. Heat olive oil in sauté pan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add 'nduja and cook until it melts and becomes fragrant. Add tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes. Add pasta and cooking water. Toss well. Add basil leaves and serve with grated cheese.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: 'Nduja is a spicy, spreadable salami from Calabria. It melts beautifully into sauces. The heat level varies, so taste and adjust. Don't overcook - the 'nduja should remain slightly chunky.

ingredients: 400g lamb shoulder, cut into cubes (14 oz)
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Cut lamb into 2cm cubes. Mix with olive oil, garlic, oregano, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Marinate for 30 minutes. Thread onto skewers. Grill over high heat for 8-10 minutes, turning frequently, until charred and cooked through. Serve immediately.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The key is high heat and frequent turning. Don't overcook - lamb should be slightly pink inside. Use wooden skewers soaked in water to prevent burning.

Mediterranean.recipe_name: Pugliese Orecchiette con Cime di Rapa
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Cook pasta in salted water until al dente. Reserve 60ml cooking water. Heat olive oil in sauté pan over medium heat. Add garlic and anchovies, cook until anchovies dissolve. Add cime di rapa and cook for 5 minutes. Add pasta and cooking water. Toss well. Add breadcrumbs and red pepper flakes. Serve immediately.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Cime di rapa (broccoli rabe) should be slightly bitter. The anchovies add umami without being fishy. Don't skip the breadcrumbs - they add texture and absorb the sauce.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Soak saffron in 2 tbsp hot stock for 10 minutes. Heat half the butter in pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until translucent. Add rice and stir for 2 minutes. Add wine and cook until absorbed. Add hot stock gradually, stirring constantly for 18-20 minutes. Add saffron and remaining butter. Stir in cheese. Season with salt. Serve immediately.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Constant stirring is essential for creamy risotto. The rice should be al dente, not mushy. Add stock gradually - about 1/2 cup at a time. The saffron should be soaked to release its color and flavor.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Soak bread in milk for 10 minutes. Squeeze out excess milk. Mix with eggs, speck, cheese, onion, parsley, salt, and pepper. Form into 8 balls. Bring stock to boil. Add canederli and simmer for 15 minutes until cooked through. Serve in hot stock.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The bread should be very stale. Don't overmix - the mixture should just hold together. The canederli should be firm but not dense. Serve immediately in hot stock.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Cook pasta in salted water until al dente. Reserve 60ml cooking water. Heat butter and olive oil in sauté pan over low heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add pasta and cooking water. Toss well. Add half the truffle and toss. Serve immediately with remaining truffle shaved on top and grated cheese.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Truffle should be added at the end to preserve its aroma. Don't heat truffle too much - it loses its flavor. Use a truffle shaver for thin slices. The pasta should be al dente to hold the sauce.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Make ragù: Heat olive oil in pot over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, cook until soft. Add meats and cook until browned. Add wine and cook until reduced by half. Add tomatoes and stock. Simmer for 1.5 hours. Make béchamel: Melt butter, add flour, cook for 2 minutes. Add milk gradually, whisking constantly. Add nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Layer lasagna sheets, ragù, and béchamel in baking dish. Bake at 180°C (356°F) for 30 minutes until golden.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: This is the original lasagna from Marche. The chicken livers add richness. Don't skip the long simmering - it develops deep flavors. The béchamel should be smooth and creamy.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Cook pasta in salted water until al dente. Reserve 60ml cooking water. Heat olive oil in sauté pan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add broccoli and cook for 5 minutes. Add pasta and cooking water. Toss well. Add breadcrumbs and red pepper flakes. Serve with grated cheese.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Cavatelli are traditional pasta from Molise. The broccoli should be tender but not mushy. The breadcrumbs add texture and absorb the sauce. Don't overcook the garlic - it should be fragrant, not bitter.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Cut peppers into strips. Heat olive oil in sauté pan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add peppers and cook for 15 minutes until soft and slightly charred. Season with salt. Garnish with basil leaves.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The peppers should be soft but not mushy. The slight charring adds flavor. Don't overcook the garlic - it should be fragrant, not bitter. Serve as a side dish or antipasto.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Make dough: Mix flour, butter, water, and salt. Knead until smooth. Roll very thin. Make filling: Heat milk, add semolina, cook until thick. Add sugar, egg yolks, vanilla, and ricotta. Cool. Cut dough into rectangles. Place filling on each, roll up. Bake at 180°C (356°F) for 25 minutes until golden.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The dough must be very thin - almost transparent. The filling should be thick but not dry. Don't overfill - the pastry should be delicate. The sfogliatelle should be crispy on the outside, creamy inside.

utensils_required: Double boiler or heatproof bowl over pot
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Soak Fontina in milk for 2 hours. Heat in double boiler over simmering water. Whisk constantly until melted. Mix cornstarch with 2 tbsp cold milk. Add to cheese mixture. Whisk in egg yolks and butter. Season with salt. Serve immediately with bread and truffle shavings.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The key is constant whisking to prevent curdling. Don't let it boil - keep temperature low. The Fontina should be soaked to remove excess salt. Serve immediately while hot and creamy.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil in large non-stick pan over medium heat. Add potatoes in single layer. Cook for 8 minutes until golden. Flip potatoes. Sprinkle cheese evenly over top. Cook for 5 minutes until cheese is crispy and golden. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with herbs.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The potatoes should be very thin for even cooking. Don't move the frico while cooking - let it form a crust. The cheese should be crispy, not burnt. Serve immediately while hot.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Make dough: Mix flour, water, 2 tbsp olive oil, and salt. Knead until smooth. Rest for 30 minutes. Divide into 2 pieces. Roll each very thin. Place one sheet on baking sheet. Crumble stracchino over top. Cover with second sheet. Pinch edges to seal. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake at 200°C (392°F) for 20 minutes until golden and crispy.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The dough must be paper-thin - almost transparent. The stracchino should be fresh and soft. Don't overfill - the cheese should be evenly distributed. The focaccia should be crispy and golden.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Make pasta dough and roll into thin sheets. Mix pork, prosciutto, cheese, egg yolk, nutmeg, salt, and pepper for filling. Cut dough into 3cm squares. Place small amount of filling in center of each square. Fold diagonally to form triangle. Pinch edges to seal. Bring corners together to form ring. Cook in boiling chicken stock for 3-4 minutes. Serve in hot stock with grated cheese.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The tortellini should be small and delicate. Don't overfill - the pasta should be thin. The filling should be well-seasoned. Serve immediately in hot, clear broth.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Season steak with salt and pepper. Heat grill to high. Brush with olive oil. Grill for 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare. Add garlic and rosemary to grill for last 2 minutes. Rest for 5 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The steak must be very thick - at least 3cm. Don't overcook - it should be rare to medium-rare. The bone adds flavor. Let it rest before serving to redistribute juices.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Make dough: Mix flour, sugar, butter, egg yolk, Marsala, and salt. Knead until smooth. Rest for 30 minutes. Roll very thin. Cut into rectangles. Wrap around cannoli tubes. Fry in hot oil until golden. Cool. Make filling: Mix ricotta, sugar, vanilla, orange peel, and chocolate chips. Fill cannoli shells. Serve immediately.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The dough must be very thin. Don't overfill the cannoli - they should be delicate. The ricotta should be well-drained. Fill just before serving to keep shells crispy.

ingredients: 100ml extra virgin olive oil (3.4 fl oz)
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil and butter in small saucepan over low heat. Add anchovies and cook until they dissolve. Add garlic and cook for 5 minutes. Season with salt. Keep warm. Serve with raw vegetables for dipping.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The key is low heat - don't let it boil. The anchovies should dissolve completely. The garlic should be soft but not brown. Serve warm with fresh, crisp vegetables.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Season veal shanks with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in pot over medium-high heat. Brown shanks on all sides. Remove and set aside. Add onion, carrots, and celery. Cook until soft. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add wine and cook until reduced by half. Add tomatoes, stock, and bay leaves. Return shanks to pot. Simmer for 1.5 hours until tender. Serve with gremolata.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The key is browning the shanks well for flavor. Don't skip the long simmering - it makes the meat tender. The gremolata adds brightness. Serve with risotto or polenta.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Dust sardines with flour. Heat half the olive oil in sauté pan over medium heat. Fry sardines until golden. Remove and set aside. Add onions to same pan. Cook until soft and golden. Add vinegar and cook for 5 minutes. Add pine nuts and raisins. Season with salt and pepper. Layer sardines and onion mixture in dish. Refrigerate for 24 hours before serving.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The sardines should be very fresh. The onions should be soft and sweet. The dish needs to marinate for at least 24 hours. Serve cold as an antipasto.

ingredients: 100ml (3.4 fl oz) San Marzano tomato sauce
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Preheat oven to 500°F (260°C) with pizza stone. Stretch dough to 12-inch circle. Spread tomato sauce leaving 1-inch border. Tear mozzarella into small pieces and distribute evenly. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 2-3 minutes until crust is golden and cheese bubbles. Remove from oven, add fresh basil leaves, and serve immediately.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Use high-protein flour for better gluten development. Don't over-sauce the pizza. The mozzarella should be room temperature. Work quickly to prevent dough from sticking.

ingredients: 60ml (2 fl oz) extra virgin olive oil
Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Sauté onion and garlic in 1 tbsp olive oil until soft. Mix spinach, feta, ricotta, eggs, herbs, and onion mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Brush baking dish with olive oil. Layer 3 phyllo sheets, brushing each with oil. Add filling. Top with remaining phyllo sheets, brushing each with oil. Bake for 35-40 minutes until golden brown. Let cool 10 minutes before serving.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Squeeze excess water from spinach. Keep phyllo covered with damp towel. The filling should be well-seasoned. Let it rest before cutting to prevent crumbling.

ingredients: 50g (1.8 oz) green beans, cut in half
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil in paella pan over medium-high heat. Season and brown chicken and rabbit pieces. Add green beans and cook 2 minutes. Add tomato and garlic, cook until reduced. Add rice and stir to coat. Add hot stock, saffron, and paprika. Bring to boil, then reduce heat. Add shrimp and butter beans. Cook 15-18 minutes without stirring. Increase heat for final 2 minutes to create socarrat. Remove from heat and rest 5 minutes before serving.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Use bomba rice for authentic texture. Don't stir after adding stock. The socarrat (crispy bottom) is essential. Cook over even heat source.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Make dough with flour, egg, water, and salt. Knead until smooth, rest 30 minutes. Mix lamb, onion, garlic, spices, salt, and pepper for filling. Roll dough thin and cut into 2-inch squares. Place 1 tsp filling in each square. Fold corners to center, pinch edges. Steam manti for 20-25 minutes until cooked through. Melt butter with mint. Mix yogurt with crushed garlic. Serve manti with yogurt sauce and melted butter.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Dough should be thin but not tearing. Seal edges well to prevent filling from leaking. Steam until dumplings are firm. The yogurt sauce should be tangy and garlicky.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Season lamb with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in tagine over medium heat. Brown lamb on all sides. Add onion and garlic, cook until soft. Add all spices and cook 2 minutes until fragrant. Add stock, bring to boil, then reduce heat. Cover and simmer 1 hour. Add apricots and almonds, cook 30 minutes more until lamb is tender. Adjust seasoning and serve with couscous.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Brown meat well for depth of flavor. Toast spices briefly to release aromas. The tagine should simmer gently. Let it rest before serving to develop flavors.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Soak bulgur in water 30 minutes, drain well. Mix bulgur with half the lamb, grated onion, and spices. Process until smooth paste. For filling, cook remaining lamb with diced onion, pine nuts, and cumin. Season well. Shape bulgur mixture into balls, hollow out center, fill with meat mixture, seal. Deep fry in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels and serve hot.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Bulgur must be well-drained. The outer shell should be thin but sealed. Fry in batches to maintain oil temperature. Serve immediately for best texture.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix flour, sugar, and salt. Cut in butter until crumbly. Add egg yolk and Marsala, form into dough. Rest 30 minutes. Roll very thin, cut into 4-inch circles. Wrap around cannoli tubes, seal edges. Fry in hot oil until golden. Cool and remove tubes. Mix ricotta, powdered sugar, and vanilla. Fold in chocolate chips and orange peel. Pipe filling into shells. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Dough must be very thin. Seal edges well to prevent opening during frying. Don't overfill shells. Fill just before serving to keep shells crisp.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Salt eggplant slices, let drain 30 minutes. Rinse and pat dry. Fry eggplant until golden. Brown lamb with onion and garlic. Add tomatoes and spices, simmer 20 minutes. Make béchamel: melt butter, add flour, cook 2 minutes. Add milk gradually, whisk until thick. Remove from heat, add eggs and half the cheese. Layer eggplant, meat sauce, repeat. Top with béchamel and remaining cheese. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 45 minutes until golden.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Salt eggplant to remove bitterness. Let moussaka rest 15 minutes before cutting. The béchamel should be thick but pourable. Use fresh spices for best flavor.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Roughly chop all vegetables. Blend tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, onion, and garlic until smooth. Strain through fine sieve to remove seeds and skin. Whisk in olive oil, vinegar, salt, and cumin. Chill for at least 2 hours. Adjust seasoning. Serve cold with fresh basil garnish.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Use very ripe tomatoes for best flavor. Strain well for smooth texture. Chill thoroughly before serving. The soup should be well-seasoned and refreshing.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix nuts with cinnamon and cloves. Brush baking dish with butter. Layer 8 sheets phyllo, brushing each with butter. Sprinkle with half the nut mixture. Layer 4 more sheets, brushing with butter. Add remaining nuts. Top with remaining phyllo sheets, brushing each with butter. Cut into diamonds. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45 minutes. Make syrup: boil sugar, water, lemon juice, and vanilla for 10 minutes. Pour hot syrup over hot baklava. Cool completely before serving.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Keep phyllo covered with damp towel. Cut before baking for clean edges. Syrup should be hot when poured. Let cool completely for best texture.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Gremolata: 2 tbsp parsley, 1 clove garlic, 1 tsp lemon zest
utensils_required: Large Dutch oven or heavy pot
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Season veal shanks with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil and butter in Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Brown shanks on all sides, remove and set aside. Add onion, carrot, and celery, cook until soft. Add garlic, cook 1 minute. Add wine, reduce by half. Add stock, tomatoes, tomato paste, thyme, and bay leaf. Return shanks to pot. Cover and simmer 1.5 hours until tender. Make gremolata: mix parsley, garlic, and lemon zest. Serve shanks with sauce and gremolata.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Brown shanks well for deep flavor. The marrow should be soft and creamy. Don't skip the gremolata - it brightens the dish. Serve with risotto alla milanese.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Tzatziki: 1/2 cup Greek yogurt, 1/2 cucumber, 1 clove garlic, 1 tbsp dill, 1 tbsp olive oil
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix pork with olive oil, garlic, oregano, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Marinate 2 hours minimum. Thread meat onto skewers. Grill over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until cooked through and charred, about 10-12 minutes. Make tzatziki: grate cucumber, squeeze out water, mix with yogurt, garlic, dill, and olive oil. Serve souvlaki with tzatziki and pita bread.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Don't overcook the pork - it should be juicy. Let meat rest before serving. The tzatziki should be thick and tangy. Serve immediately while hot.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Add potatoes and onion, season with salt. Cook gently, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are tender but not browned, about 15-20 minutes. Beat eggs with salt. Remove potatoes and onion with slotted spoon, mix with eggs. Heat 2 tbsp oil in same skillet. Add egg mixture, cook over medium heat until bottom is set. Flip using plate, cook other side until golden. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Cook potatoes slowly for best texture. The tortilla should be slightly runny in the center. Use a plate to flip safely. Let it rest before cutting.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Fresh parsley and lemon wedges for serving
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix lamb with onion, garlic, tomato, tomato paste, cumin, paprika, cinnamon, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Let rest 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 500°F (260°C). Roll dough thin into 8-inch circle. Spread meat mixture evenly, leaving small border. Bake 8-10 minutes until edges are golden and meat is cooked. Serve hot with parsley and lemon wedges.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The meat mixture should be well-seasoned. Roll dough very thin for crispy base. Don't overbake - the meat should be just cooked. Serve immediately while hot.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil in saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, carrot, and zucchini, cook until soft. Add spices and saffron, cook 1 minute until fragrant. Add stock, bring to boil. Remove from heat, add couscous, cover and let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork, add chickpeas and parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Don't stir couscous while cooking - just fluff with fork. The vegetables should be tender but not mushy. Let it rest covered for best texture.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Heat stock and keep warm. Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms, cook until golden and tender. Remove and set aside. Add shallot and garlic, cook until soft. Add rice, stir to coat. Add wine, stir until absorbed. Add warm stock 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly until absorbed. Continue until rice is creamy and al dente, about 18-20 minutes. Stir in mushrooms, butter, and Parmesan. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately with parsley.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Keep stock warm throughout cooking. Stir constantly for creamy texture. The rice should be al dente, not mushy. Add butter and cheese off heat.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix rice with onion, herbs, olive oil, lemon juice, allspice, salt, and pepper. Place grape leaves vein-side up. Add 1 tbsp rice mixture to center of each leaf. Fold sides over filling, then roll from bottom to top. Place seam-side down in pot. Add stock to cover. Place plate on top to weigh down. Simmer 45 minutes until rice is tender. Let cool in liquid. Serve at room temperature.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Don't overfill the leaves. Roll tightly but not too tight. The plate keeps them submerged. Let them cool in the cooking liquid for best flavor.

ingredients: Bravas sauce: 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 small onion, 2 cloves garlic, 200g canned tomatoes, 1 tsp smoked paprika, 1/2 tsp cayenne, 1 tsp sugar
Aioli: 2 tbsp mayonnaise, 1 clove garlic, 1 tsp lemon juice
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Toss potatoes with olive oil, paprika, and salt. Roast 25 minutes until golden and crispy. For bravas sauce: sauté onion and garlic in olive oil until soft. Add tomatoes, paprika, cayenne, and sugar. Simmer 15 minutes, blend until smooth. For aioli: mix mayonnaise, garlic, and lemon juice. Serve potatoes with both sauces.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Cut potatoes evenly for even cooking. The bravas sauce should be spicy and slightly sweet. The aioli should be garlicky and tangy. Serve immediately while hot.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onion and bell pepper, cook until soft. Add garlic, cook 1 minute. Add tomato, cumin, paprika, and red pepper flakes. Cook until tomatoes break down. Beat eggs with salt and pepper. Add to skillet, stir gently until eggs are just set. Don't overcook - eggs should be creamy. Serve hot with fresh parsley.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Don't overcook the eggs - they should be soft and creamy. The vegetables should be tender but not mushy. Serve immediately while hot.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Cook pasta in salted boiling water until al dente. Meanwhile, cook guanciale in skillet over medium heat until crispy. Add garlic, cook 1 minute. Beat eggs with cheese and pepper. Drain pasta, reserving 1/2 cup pasta water. Add hot pasta to skillet with guanciale. Remove from heat, add egg mixture, tossing quickly. Add pasta water if needed for creaminess. Serve immediately with extra cheese.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Never add cream to carbonara. The eggs should create the sauce. Work quickly to prevent scrambling. The pasta should be very hot when adding eggs.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil in pot over medium heat. Add onion, carrot, and celery, cook until soft. Add garlic, cook 1 minute. Add stock, bring to boil. Add orzo, cook until tender. Beat eggs with lemon juice. Slowly add 1 cup hot soup to egg mixture, whisking constantly. Return to pot, stirring constantly. Don't boil. Season with salt, pepper, and dill. Serve hot.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Temper the eggs slowly to prevent curdling. Don't let the soup boil after adding eggs. The soup should be silky and smooth.

ingredients: Chocolate sauce: 100g dark chocolate, 100ml heavy cream, 1 tbsp sugar
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Heat water, butter, salt, and sugar to boil. Add flour all at once, stir until smooth ball forms. Cool slightly. Beat in eggs one at a time. Heat oil to 375°F (190°C). Pipe 6-inch strips into hot oil. Fry until golden, turning once. Drain on paper towels. Roll in cinnamon sugar. For chocolate sauce: heat cream, add chocolate and sugar, stir until smooth. Serve churros with chocolate sauce.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The dough should be smooth and pipeable. Don't overmix after adding eggs. Fry in batches to maintain oil temperature. Serve immediately while hot.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix yeast, sugar, and warm water. Let foam 5 minutes. Mix flour and salt. Add yeast mixture and olive oil. Knead until smooth. Rise 1 hour. For filling: cook lamb with onion, garlic, tomato, cumin, and paprika. Season well. Roll dough into oval. Add filling, leaving border. Fold edges over, pinch ends. Brush with egg, sprinkle sesame seeds. Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 20-25 minutes until golden.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The dough should be soft but not sticky. Don't overfill the pide. The edges should be well-sealed. Bake until golden brown.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil in pot over medium heat. Brown lamb on all sides. Add onion, carrot, and celery, cook until soft. Add garlic, cook 1 minute. Add tomatoes, tomato paste, spices, and saffron. Cook 5 minutes. Add stock, bring to boil. Add chickpeas and lentils. Simmer 45 minutes until tender. Season with salt and pepper. Add fresh herbs. Serve hot.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Brown the lamb well for depth of flavor. The soup should be thick and hearty. Add herbs at the end for freshness.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Beat egg yolks with sugar until pale and thick. Add mascarpone and vanilla, beat until smooth. Mix coffee with liqueur. Dip ladyfingers in coffee mixture, don't soak. Layer half the ladyfingers in dish. Spread half the mascarpone mixture. Repeat layers. Dust with cocoa powder. Refrigerate 4 hours or overnight. Serve chilled.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Don't over-soak the ladyfingers. The mascarpone mixture should be smooth and creamy. Let it chill thoroughly before serving.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix yeast, sugar, and warm water. Let foam 5 minutes. Mix flour and salt. Add yeast mixture and olive oil. Beat until smooth batter. Rise 30 minutes. Heat oil to 375°F (190°C). Drop batter by tablespoonfuls into hot oil. Fry until golden, turning once. Drain on paper towels. Drizzle with honey, dust with cinnamon, garnish with walnuts. Serve immediately.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The batter should be thick but pourable. Don't overmix. Fry in batches to maintain oil temperature. Serve hot for best texture.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Make caramel: heat sugar and water in saucepan until golden brown. Pour into ramekin, swirl to coat bottom. Beat eggs with milk, vanilla, and salt. Strain mixture into ramekin. Place in baking dish with hot water halfway up sides. Bake at 325°F (160°C) for 45 minutes until set. Cool, then refrigerate 4 hours. Run knife around edge, invert onto plate.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Don't stir the caramel while cooking. The water bath prevents cracking. The flan should be set but still jiggly in center. Chill thoroughly before unmolding.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Tzatziki and fresh vegetables for serving
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix lamb with onion, garlic, spices, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Marinate 2 hours. Thread meat onto skewers or arrange on doner spit. Grill over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until cooked through and charred, about 15-20 minutes. Let rest 5 minutes. Slice thinly. Serve in pita with tzatziki and fresh vegetables.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Slice meat very thin for best texture. Don't overcook - lamb should be juicy. Let it rest before slicing. Serve immediately while hot.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix yeast, sugar, and warm water. Let foam 5 minutes. Mix flour and salt. Add yeast mixture and 2 tbsp olive oil. Knead until smooth. Rise 1 hour. Oil baking pan. Press dough into pan. Cover, rise 30 minutes. Dimple surface with fingers. Drizzle with remaining olive oil. Sprinkle with rosemary and sea salt. Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 20-25 minutes until golden.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The dough should be soft and sticky. Don't over-knead. The dimples help with even baking. The focaccia should be golden and crispy on top.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Cook pasta until al dente, drain. Brown lamb with onion and garlic. Add tomatoes and spices, simmer 20 minutes. Make béchamel: melt butter, add flour, cook 2 minutes. Add milk gradually, whisk until thick. Remove from heat, add eggs and half the cheese. Layer half the pasta in dish. Add meat sauce. Top with remaining pasta. Pour béchamel over top. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 45 minutes until golden.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The meat sauce should be well-seasoned. The béchamel should be thick but pourable. Let it rest before cutting. The top should be golden brown.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix meats with grated onion, garlic, egg, breadcrumbs, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Form into small balls. Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Brown meatballs on all sides. Remove and set aside. Add diced onion, garlic, and carrot to same pan. Cook until soft. Add tomatoes, bring to boil. Return meatballs to pan. Simmer 20 minutes until cooked through. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Don't overmix the meat mixture. Brown the meatballs well for flavor. The sauce should be thick and rich. Let them simmer gently.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Cut eggplants in half lengthwise. Score flesh, salt, and let drain 30 minutes. Rinse and pat dry. Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in skillet. Add onions, cook until soft. Add garlic, cook 1 minute. Add tomatoes, herbs, and spices. Cook 10 minutes. Stuff eggplant halves with mixture. Place in baking dish. Drizzle with remaining olive oil. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 45 minutes until tender. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Salt the eggplants to remove bitterness. The filling should be well-seasoned. Don't overstuff the eggplants. Let them cool slightly before serving.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Season veal with salt and pepper. Top each cutlet with 2 slices prosciutto and 2 sage leaves. Secure with toothpicks. Heat olive oil and butter in skillet over medium-high heat. Cook cutlets 2-3 minutes per side until golden. Remove and set aside. Add shallot and garlic to same pan. Cook until soft. Add wine, reduce by half. Return cutlets to pan. Simmer 2 minutes. Remove toothpicks. Serve hot with sauce.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Don't overcook the veal - it should be tender. The prosciutto should be crispy. The sauce should be reduced and flavorful. Serve immediately.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix lamb with onion, garlic, herbs, egg, breadcrumbs, cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper. Form into small balls. Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Cook meatballs until golden and cooked through, about 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with tzatziki.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Don't overmix the meat mixture. The meatballs should be golden brown. Don't overcook - they should be juicy. Serve immediately while hot.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Make béchamel: melt butter, add flour, cook 2 minutes. Add milk gradually, whisk until thick. Add jamón, onion, garlic, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Cook 5 minutes. Cool completely. Shape into small cylinders. Dip in egg, then breadcrumbs. Refrigerate 30 minutes. Heat oil to 375°F (190°C). Fry until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The béchamel should be thick. Let it cool completely before shaping. The croquetas should be golden and crispy. Serve immediately while hot.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix cheeses with eggs, onion, garlic, herbs, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Brush baking dish with butter. Layer 6 sheets phyllo, brushing each with butter. Add half the cheese mixture. Layer 4 more sheets, brushing with butter. Add remaining cheese mixture. Top with remaining phyllo sheets, brushing each with butter. Cut into squares. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 45 minutes until golden. Let cool 10 minutes before serving.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Keep phyllo covered with damp towel. The filling should be well-seasoned. Don't overfill. Let it rest before cutting.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Soak gelatin in cold water 5 minutes. Heat cream with sugar and vanilla until hot but not boiling. Remove from heat. Add gelatin, stir until dissolved. Pour into ramekins. Refrigerate 4 hours or overnight until set. Run knife around edge, invert onto plate. Serve with fresh berries and mint.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Don't boil the cream. The gelatin should be completely dissolved. Let it chill thoroughly. Serve cold for best texture.

ingredients: Syrup: 200g sugar, 150ml water, 1 tbsp lemon juice
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Heat milk with semolina, sugar, and cinnamon. Cook until thick. Beat eggs with vanilla. Add to milk mixture, cook 2 minutes. Cool. Brush baking dish with butter. Layer 8 sheets phyllo, brushing each with butter. Add filling. Top with remaining phyllo sheets, brushing each with butter. Cut into squares. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 45 minutes until golden. Make syrup: boil sugar, water, and lemon juice for 10 minutes. Pour hot syrup over hot pastry. Cool completely. Dust with cinnamon before serving.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The filling should be thick. Keep phyllo covered. The syrup should be hot when poured. Let it cool completely for best texture.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Bring large pot of water to boil. Add octopus, cook 30-40 minutes until tender. Remove and cool. Slice into rounds. Arrange potatoes on plate. Top with octopus. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with paprika, cumin, and sea salt. Garnish with parsley. Serve at room temperature.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The octopus should be very tender. Don't overcook. The potatoes should be warm. The dish should be well-seasoned.

ingredients: Syrup: 200g sugar, 150ml water, 1 tbsp lemon juice
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Mix kadaif with melted butter. Press half into baking dish. Add mozzarella. Top with remaining kadaif. Press down firmly. Bake 25-30 minutes until golden. Make syrup: boil sugar, water, and lemon juice for 10 minutes. Pour hot syrup over hot pastry. Let cool 10 minutes. Garnish with pistachios and cinnamon. Serve warm.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Press the kadaif firmly. The mozzarella should be fresh. The syrup should be hot when poured. Let it cool slightly before serving.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Make risotto: sauté onion and garlic. Add rice, stir to coat. Add stock gradually, stirring constantly. Add mushrooms and peas. Cook until rice is tender and creamy. Add Parmesan. Cool completely. Form into balls. Dip in egg, then breadcrumbs. Refrigerate 30 minutes. Heat oil to 375°F (190°C). Fry until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: The risotto should be creamy but not too wet. Let it cool completely before shaping. The arancini should be golden and crispy. Serve immediately while hot.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix nuts with cinnamon and cloves. Brush baking dish with butter. Layer 8 sheets phyllo, brushing each with butter. Sprinkle with half the nut mixture. Layer 4 more sheets, brushing with butter. Add remaining nuts. Top with remaining phyllo sheets, brushing each with butter. Cut into diamonds. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45 minutes until golden. Make syrup: boil sugar, water, lemon juice, and vanilla for 10 minutes. Pour hot syrup over hot baklava. Cool completely before serving.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Keep phyllo covered with damp towel. Cut before baking for clean edges. The syrup should be hot when poured. Let it cool completely for best texture.

ingredients: Alioli: 2 large egg yolks, 2 cloves garlic, 1/2 cup olive oil, 1 tbsp lemon juice, salt to taste
utensils_required: Food processor or mortar and pestle
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Toss potatoes with olive oil, paprika, and salt. Roast 25 minutes until golden and crispy. For alioli: process egg yolks and garlic until smooth. Slowly add olive oil while processing. Add lemon juice and salt. Serve potatoes with alioli.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Cut potatoes evenly for even cooking. The alioli should be thick and garlicky. Don't overprocess. Serve immediately while hot.

ingredients: Syrup: 300g sugar, 400ml water, 1 tbsp lemon juice
Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Beat eggs with sugar until pale and thick. Add flour, semolina, baking powder, and vanilla. Mix until smooth. Pour into greased baking dish. Bake 25-30 minutes until golden. Make syrup: boil sugar, water, and lemon juice for 10 minutes. Pour hot syrup over hot cake. Let cool completely. Garnish with pistachios. Cut into squares and serve.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Beat the eggs well for light texture. The syrup should be hot when poured. Let it cool completely before cutting. The cake should be moist and sweet.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Soak gelatin in cold water 5 minutes. Heat cream with sugar, coffee, and vanilla until hot but not boiling. Remove from heat. Add gelatin, stir until dissolved. Pour into ramekins. Refrigerate 4 hours or overnight until set. Run knife around edge, invert onto plate. Garnish with chocolate shavings. Serve cold.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Don't boil the cream. The coffee should be well-dissolved. Let it chill thoroughly. The panna cotta should be smooth and creamy.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix nuts with cinnamon and cloves. Brush baking dish with butter. Layer half the kataifi, brushing with butter. Sprinkle with half the nut mixture. Add remaining kataifi, brushing with butter. Sprinkle with remaining nuts. Top with remaining kataifi, brushing with butter. Cut into squares. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45 minutes until golden. Make syrup: boil sugar, water, lemon juice, and vanilla for 10 minutes. Pour hot syrup over hot pastry. Cool completely before serving.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Keep kataifi covered with damp towel. The nuts should be well-distributed. The syrup should be hot when poured. Let it cool completely for best texture.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Cut tomatoes in half. Mix all ingredients in a bowl. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Sprinkle with oregano and salt. Toss gently.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Use mild feta cheese for kids. Make it colorful and appealing. Cut everything into bite-sized pieces.
Mediterranean.lunchbox_presentation: Serve in small colorful cups. Arrange in bento box compartments. Decorate with fresh herbs.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Spread hummus on tortillas. Add vegetables and tahini. Drizzle with lemon juice. Roll tightly and cut into bite-sized pieces.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Use mild hummus for kids. Make it colorful and appealing. Cut into small pieces for easy eating.
Mediterranean.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange wrap pieces in bento box. Decorate with fresh herbs.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Cut pita breads in half. Fill with tzatziki sauce, vegetables, and feta cheese. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with oregano.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Use mild tzatziki for kids. Make it colorful and appealing. Cut into small pieces for easy eating.
Mediterranean.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange pita pockets in bento box. Decorate with fresh herbs.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Process chickpeas with onion, parsley, and spices. Add flour and egg. Shape into small balls. Fry until golden brown and crispy.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Use mild spices for kids. Make mini versions for easy handling. Serve with tahini sauce.
Mediterranean.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange falafel balls in bento box. Add tahini sauce in small container. Decorate with fresh herbs.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix cooked pasta with vegetables and feta cheese. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Sprinkle with oregano and toss gently.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Use mild feta cheese for kids. Make it colorful and appealing. Serve cold or at room temperature.
Mediterranean.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange pasta salad in bento box. Decorate with fresh herbs.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix rice with herbs, pine nuts, olive oil, lemon juice, and dill. Place filling on grape leaves. Roll tightly and steam for 15 minutes.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Use mild herbs for kids. Make mini versions for easy handling. Serve with lemon wedges.
Mediterranean.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange stuffed grape leaves in bento box. Decorate with lemon wedges and fresh herbs.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Thread vegetables and feta cheese onto skewers. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Sprinkle with oregano. Grill until vegetables are tender.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Use mild feta cheese for kids. Make colorful skewers. Serve with tzatziki sauce.
Mediterranean.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange skewers in bento box. Add tzatziki sauce in small container. Decorate with fresh herbs.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix rice with parmesan, herbs, pine nuts, olive oil, lemon juice, and oregano. Shape into small balls. Chill before serving.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Use mild parmesan for kids. Make colorful balls. Add fresh herbs for flavor.
Mediterranean.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange rice balls in bento box. Decorate with fresh herbs and pine nuts.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Mix all fruits in a bowl. Drizzle with honey and lemon juice. Garnish with mint leaves and pistachios.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Use fresh, ripe fruits. Make it colorful and appealing. Add sweet honey for kids.
Mediterranean.lunchbox_presentation: Serve in colorful bowl. Decorate with mint leaves and pistachios.

Mediterranean.cooking_instructions: Blend yogurt with berries, honey, milk, and vanilla. Add chia seeds and blend until smooth. Garnish with pistachios and mint leaves.
Mediterranean.chef_tips: Use fresh, ripe berries. Make it colorful and appealing. Add sweet honey for kids.
Mediterranean.lunchbox_presentation: Serve in colorful glass. Decorate with pistachios and mint leaves.
